availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph H. Gardner (Estill Co, Ky, merchant)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, merchant. Virginia native. Married to Mary Houston Gardner in Morgan County, Kentucky, on November 30, 1848. Father of Hamilton Gardner, William H. Gardner, Laura E. Gardner, and Jennie Gardner. Merchant in Morgan County in 1850. Merchant in Irvine in 1860. Enrolled as quarter master in the 8th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) on November 13, 1861, but never mustered in as such.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 164B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Irvine, p. 276.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Irvine, p. 558A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Morgan County Marriages, Film #000839918, p. 93.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 769.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 922.Find A Grave, "Joseph H. Gardner (July 1, 1820-April 4, 1874)," Memorial #52301604, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52301604 (accessed April 1, 2021).
